title: Civil claims: evicting a tenant using accelerated possession
description: Accelerated property possession is used when people refuse to leave a property and have been given the appropriate notice to leave.

transaction.title: Evict a tenant using accelerated possession

modules.title: Cost per transaction
modules.description: Average end-to-end cost of a claim
info: Data source: HMCTS

This figure is based on an HMCTS methodology for modelling volumes across the civil workload. This value is based on 26210 accelerated possession claims being issued and the predicted case stages each one of these claims would reach.
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing an end-to-end service for an accelerated possession claim across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs are all included.

modules.title: Live service usage
modules.description: Users currently on the GOV.UK start page for the service
info: Data source: Google Analytics
Shows the estimated number of users currently on the GOV.UK start page for the service.

modules.title: Claims breakdown
modules.description: Digital and paper form claims over time
info: Data source: MOJ database
Shows the number of successful claims, broken down by channel
Digital: downloads of the online claim form. Forms downloaded and claims issued may not be the same because downloads do not necessarily result in claims being issued.
Paper form: claims made using a paper form. Paper forms are calculated as the difference between the total number of claim forms received in court and the number of online claim forms downloaded.

modules.title: Digital take-up
modules.description: Proportion of claims made using the digital service
info: The service includes a print out of a pdf. We are able to measure the number of times a pdf is downloaded.

We are also able to measure the number of claims that are issued in court, which are published as National Statistics here https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/mortgage-and-landlord-possession-statistics
The claims downloaded and claims issued will not be the same as a download does not necessarily result in a claim being issued.

modules.title: User satisfaction
modules.description: Overall satisfaction score includes all ratings weighted from 100% for 'very satisfied' to 0% for 'very dissatisfied'
info: Data source: GOV.UK user feedback database

User satisfaction is measured by surveying users at the point of transaction completion. It is measured on a five-point scale, from most satisfied to least satisfied. The mean of these responses is converted to a percentage for display purposes.
This is a measure of the initial digital interface. It does not cover the end-to-end service that is outlined in the cost per transaction

modules.title: Completion rate
modules.description: Proportion of users who start and download their claim form using the digital service
info: Data source: Google Analytics
This is a measure of the initial digital interface. It does not cover the end-to-end service that is outlined in the cost per transaction

modules.title: Service availability
info: Data source: Pingdom
Page load time measures the time taken for a sample page within the service to load.
Uptime measures the percentage of time that the service was observed to be available.
